intro: Hieracium eriobasis subsp. eriobasis, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, forming a dense cluster at the top of the stem. The plant is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
